page.title: 17THE RIVER STOUR
page.content: The river Stour, as it runs through this area, is a{tidal estuary}over a mile wide. It becomes tidal eight miles upsteam from Parkeston, and joins the{River Orwell}about one and half miles downsteam. It is an important{artery for shipping}being dredged deep enough at Parkeston for the large Continental ferries,and a channel all the way to Mistley for smaller vessels. It is a very{attractive}river flowing past some beautiful areas.It forms the {boundary between Essex and Suffolk}and on both sides are farmland and woodland. It is not possible to reach the shore by car but the walk is well rewarded by the peace and almost unspoilt beauty of both banks. The river itself is well used by small{pleasure craft,}wind surfers and the occasional Thames barge.
